intro: Humboltia bicruris, commonly known as the two-winged tamarack, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-winged fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and is adapted to saline environments. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Humboltia bicruris plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and is of interest for its ecological and botanical significance.
